alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 20 at 10:51AM PDT until March 22 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * CHANGES...Winter Weather Advisory expiring at 11 AM. * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 4 to 14 inches above 7000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
